questions.question: What is the empirical formula of ZIF-8-V?
What method was used for the post-synthetic modification of ZIF-8-V to introduce perfluoroalkyl groups?
What was the contact angle of water on ZIF-8-VF sample?
How does the BET surface area of ZIF-8-V compare to ZIF-8-VF?
questions.answer: ZIF-8-V and ZIF-8-VF have similar BET surface areas.

questions.question: What was the main purpose of coating ZIF-8-V with perfluoroalkyl groups?
questions.answer: To impart amphiphobicity on the exterior surface of the MOF, making it both superhydrophobic and oleophobic.

questions.question: True or False: The postmodification process of ZIF-8-V to create ZIF-8-VF significantly blocked the pores in the material.
What was the effect of amphiphobicity on the stability of ZIF-8-VF under humidified CO2 conditions?
questions.answer: It made ZIF-8-VF highly stable, preventing structural degradation under humidified CO2 conditions.

questions.question: True or False: ZIF-8-VF adsorbs a significant amount of water even at low relative humidity.
What was the main challenge addressed by imparting amphiphobicity on MOFs?
questions.answer: Enhancing the stability of MOFs towards moisture/water and humidified CO2.

questions.question: True or False: The amphiphobic MOFs demonstrated exceptional chemical stability in both acidic and basic aqueous solutions.
What was the yield percentage of the powder ZIF-8-V crystal synthesis?
What was the role of 1H,1H,2H,2H-perfluorodecanethiol in the modification of ZIF-8-V?
questions.answer: It was used to graft perfluoroalkyl groups onto the exterior surface of ZIF-8-V.

questions.question: True or False: The contact angles of various organic compounds on ZIF-8-VF were all above 150°.
What was the main finding from the X-ray photoemission spectroscopy experiments on ZIF-8-VF?
questions.answer: Perfluoroalkyl groups were mainly attached to the vinyl groups on the exterior surface of ZIF-8-V crystals.

questions.question: True or False: The amphiphobic MOFs were created without affecting the crystallinity and porosity of the original MOF materials.
What was the temperature used for the covalent post-synthetic modification of ZIF-8-V?
How did the amphiphobic MOFs perform in water/organic vapor adsorption tests?
questions.answer: They exhibited minimal adsorption of water and organic compounds, demonstrating their amphiphobic nature.

questions.question: True or False: The amphiphobic surface modification was achieved by using a bulky fluorinated compound that could permeate into the pores of the material.
What was the chemical shift observed in the 19F MAS NMR spectra for ZIF-8-VF?
questions.answer: Similar to that of the perfluoroalkyl groups in the 1H,1H,2H,2H-perfluorodecanethiol compound.

questions.question: True or False: The amphiphobic MOFs were tested for their ability to separate oil-water mixtures.
